name: Frank HENRY, Appellant, v. CONTROL PRODUCTS COMPANY v. CERRO CORPORATION and Cerro Wire and Cable Company

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, KAUFFMAN and WILKINSON, JJ.
parties: Frank HENRY, Appellant, v. CONTROL PRODUCTS COMPANY v. CERRO CORPORATION and Cerro Wire and Cable Company.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM:
The appeal, 426 A.2d 116, is dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Mark B. Aronson, Behrend, Aronson & Morrow, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Paul D. Kruper, George M. Evan, Pittsburgh, for Control Products.
Daniel B. Winters, Charles Kirshner, Pittsburgh, for Cerro Corp. and Cerro Wire and Cable Co.
casebody.head_matter:
436 A.2d 982
Frank HENRY, Appellant, v. CONTROL PRODUCTS COMPANY v. CERRO CORPORATION and Cerro Wire and Cable Company.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Sept. 17, 1981.
Decided Oct. 8, 1981.
Reargument Denied Nov. 25, 1981.
Mark B. Aronson, Behrend, Aronson & Morrow, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Paul D. Kruper, George M. Evan, Pittsburgh, for Control Products.
Daniel B. Winters, Charles Kirshner, Pittsburgh, for Cerro Corp. and Cerro Wire and Cable Co.
Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, KAUFFMAN and WILKINSON, JJ.
